question: The "Creole in the Park" festival is celebrated in which country?
explanation: The Creole in the Park festival is celebrated in the island country of Dominica in the Windward Islands of the Lesser Antilles Archipelago. It is a celebration of Creole culture which features live music from local and regional artists as well as traditional dancing, steel pan and wonderful Creole cuisine. It is usually held in the Botanical Gardens, Roseau, the capital city of Dominica. This three-day annual event usually held before the World Creole Music Festival.
